com.teamten.chess

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.teamten.chess.Move

  • public class Move
extends Object
    Stores a move in a chess game and its inverse.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Comparator<Move> CAPTURE_COMPARATOR
      A comparator that puts best captures first.

    • Method Detail

      • make

        public static Move make(Board board,
                        int fromIndex,
                        int toIndex)
        Alternative constructor where the moving and captured pieces are determined by the board. Pawns are not promoted.

      • makePromotion

        public static Move makePromotion(Board board,
                                 int fromIndex,
                                 int toIndex,
                                 Piece promotedPiece)
        Alternative constructor where the moving and captured pieces are determined by the board.

        public static Move parseLongAlgebraicNotation(Board board,
                                              String lan)
        Parse an long algebraic notation (LAN).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the string is not in LAN.

      • applyInverseMove

        public void applyInverseMove(Board board)
        Applies the inverse of this move. The applyMove() method must have already been called.

      • getAlgebraicNotation

        public String getAlgebraicNotation(boolean useFigurine)
        Return the Algebraic Notation. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algebraic_Chess_Notation
        Parameters:
        useFigurine - if true, uses the HTML for a drawing instead of a piece name.

      • getLongAlgebraicNotation

        public String getLongAlgebraicNotation()
        Return the long algebraic notation for the move, e.g., "e2e4" or "b7b8q".

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • serialize

        public String serialize()
        Serialize the move to a string. Deserialize later with deserialize(). The string contains only URL-safe characters (a-z, A-Z, digits, and hyphens).

      • deserialize

        public static Move deserialize(String str)
        Deserialize a move from the string created by serialize().
